Underwater exploration: Without the need for equipment, people would be able to explore the depths of the ocean and discover new species, geological formations, and historical artifacts. This would lead to a greater understanding of our planet and its origins.

Aquatic agriculture: With the ability to breathe underwater, people could cultivate crops in the ocean, which would increase food production and reduce the need for arable land. This would also lead to the development of new farming techniques and technologies.

Underwater transportation: People could travel underwater, which would revolutionize transportation and make it faster and more efficient. This would also lead to the development of new types of vehicles and infrastructure.

Underwater construction: With the ability to breathe underwater, people could build structures in the ocean, which would lead to the development of new types of buildings and infrastructure. This would also lead to the creation of new industries and job opportunities.

Underwater medicine: People could receive medical treatment underwater, which would lead to the development of new medical technologies and treatments. This would also lead to the creation of new industries and job opportunities in the healthcare sector.
